name: Harper General: Paladin 20/ CoT 15/ Harper Scout 5
author: Mick Dagger

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
This General of the Church operates behind the curtain as a high ranking Harper.

True, we must fight, it seems often enough to keep our swords and our tempers both sharp enough.//

Moreover, ye only hear of blades drawn and death and spells hurled, and never know of the many, many times that a quiet word or a skillful deal has turned enemies aside from each other, forced a way clear where none was before//
That is the true Harper way: subtle and quiet, behind the shouting. Trust and wisdom, and outfoxing others is what we deal in.
 -Mirt the Moneylender in “Crown of Fire”

The build consists of three classes that complement each other very well.
20 levels of Paladin grants a full spell book, a high saves bonus from Charisma etc. 15 levels of CoT gives the build enough feats, high saves and a very powerful Divine wrath. HS gives Great charisma bonus feats, stacking ability buffs and valuable class skills.

Discussion:
I found no other build like this. There are only 4 builds with these classes in the old archive, and only one with this class spread, but they are all very different from this character.

This build has full BAB and a high unbuffed AB. It has several "turbo modes" to boost AB and damage further. In fact the character can buff AB to the 20 cap (GMW +5, Divine favor +5, Divine wrath +7,  Bless,Aid,Prayer +3). You can also add another +6 AB from Taunt, not counting towards the +20 cap. Smite also adds +11 AB, not counting towards the cap.
The spells Eagle's splendor, Aura of glory and the Eagle's splendor feat from HS all stack and let you cap Charisma at 32 granting a +11 bonus to the Divine feats (Divine wrath, Divine grace, Divine Might, Divine Shield, Smite evil, Lay on hands and Turn undead)

Divine favor: +5 AB, +5 damage
Taunt: +6 AB
Bless:  +1 AB,  +1 saves vs fear
Aid:  +1 AB, +1 saves vs fear
Prayer: +1AB,  +1 damage, +1 saves, +1 skills
GMW: +5 AB, +5 damage, +5 dr penetration
Holy sword: Same as GMW + Holy avenger abilities
Divine Might: +11 damage
Divine Shield: +11 AC
Smite Evil: +11 AB, +35 damage
Power attack: +5 damage
Bull’s: +2 AB,  +2 damage
Bless Weapon: +1 AB, 2d6 damage vs undead
 
Playing the character is a joy. It may feel a little slow early on with a starting strength of 15, a slightly lower AC from dexterity 8 and tumble only after level 22, but it soon picks up speed with the paladin buffs.
I could have stopped CoT at 10 and had in undispellable Paladin, but this character works well even without the spells, so here I went for better saves and a stronger Divine wrath. The number of bonus feats would not have changed.

Tweaks: Epic toughness at lvl 38 is not vital to the build. You can take Cleave, Improved PA or some other combat feat instead if you want.

Feel free to comment and share your thoughts on the build.

posts.author: Sarthrovar
posts.content: I'm not an expert at the hide/detect mechanics - so why listen as a skill instead of spot? Alertness grants a +2 bonus to Spot and Spot is a CoT class skill. I like the build a lot, just curious as to the skill choice and trying to learn something new.

posts.author: webshaman1
posts.content:
A character will be considered flat-footed if attacked by an unseen creature, unless the attacker is heard and the character has the blind fight feat. Being unseen can be the result of blindness, darkness, invisibility, stealth, or (for NPC perceivers) coming around a corner without time for the perception event to fire (a window of at most four seconds).
If one has Blindfight, Listen is the skill of choice for the above reason alone.
